sourceMeaningMnemonic: The kanji and the radical are the same, so remembering the meaning of this kanji is as simple as making sure you know the radical for <radical>writing</radical> first! If you know the radical, you know this kanji means <kanji>writing</kanji> as well.
meaningInfo: Make sure you know those radicals, yo!
readingMnemonic:
This kanji has more than one important reading you need to learn, sorry! But don't worry, here's a mnemonic to help you:

When you're <kanji>writing</kanji> you need things to fuel you. That's why you always eat <reading>bun</reading>s (<ja>ぶん</ja>) while you write. Bread bun, hot crossed buns, whatever as long as they're buns, they're great writing fuel.

When buns aren't enough, you call in the <reading>mon</reading>ster (<ja>もん</ja>) that lives under your bed. It pretends to chase you, motivating your writing even further, because if you don't write fast, you'll die by monster bites.
readingInfo: Imagine shoveling buns into your mouth and running from a monster as you're writing. You're so determined! This is going to be the best thing you've ever written!
